Dunedin Hotels Things to Do Restaurants Flights Holiday Homes Travel Stories Cruises Tours Add a Place Travel Forum Airlines Travellers' Choice Help Centre Get Happy at Happy's Bayou Bites - Happy's Bayou Bites United States Florida (FL) Dunedin Dunedin Restaurants Happy's Bayou Bites Search â€œGet Happy at Happy's Bayou Bitesâ€ Review of Happy's Bayou Bites 54 photos Happy's Bayou Bites 431 Skinner Blvd , Dunedin, FL 34698-4989 +1 727-240-1102 Website Improve this listing Ranked #27 of 199 Restaurants in Dunedin 99 Reviews Price range: $10 - $27 Description: We are a permanent food truck serving cajun, creole, and low country cuisine on picnic tables under an oak or call in for togo - We are in the downtown Dunedin area. 727-240-1102 Restaurant details Description: We are a permanent food truck serving cajun, creole, and low country cuisine on picnic tables under an oak or call in for togo - We are in the downtown Dunedin area. 727-240-1102 AJRV Clearwater, Florida 113 94 Reviewed 14 February 2017 via mobile Get Happy at Happy's Bayou Bites If you're looking for mouth watering Cajun food, you best beat feet down to Happy's Bayou Bites!! Mark's hushpuppies are outstanding and the Poor Boys are to die for!! Actually, everything on the menu is brilliant and goes well with the cold adult libations available!!! Date of visit: February 2017 Ask AJRV about Happy's Bayou Bites Thank AJRV This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Happy J, Owner at Happy's Bayou Bites, responded to this review Responded 15 February 2017 AJRV, Thanks for the shout out and hope to see you back soon! Report response as inappropriate Thank you. We appreciate your input. This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of Tripadvisor LLC Updating list... Read reviews in English Go back 62 - 66 of 99 reviews WildKate34698 Dunedin, Florida 49 39 Reviewed 25 January 2017 Old Florida feel! Fairly new place with that old Florida feel. This is like a stationary food truck. All outdoor mostly shaded seating. Super southern food with a Cajun flair. Monthly specials. Very good prices. Run by a family known for great seafood. They deliver by bicycle. Limited hours and days so check before you go. Worth it! Date of visit: January 2017 Ask WildKate34698 about Happy's Bayou Bites Thank WildKate34698 This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Happy J, Owner at Happy's Bayou Bites, responded to this review Responded 26 January 2017 Thanks Kate and glad you found us! Stop back in for our weekly special, Crawfish Etoufee. If you like Crawfish, we may be getting them in this week. Pinch the tail and suck the head! Crossing our fingers that we can get them! Report response as inappropriate Thank you. We appreciate your input. This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of Tripadvisor LLC AFairAssessment 33 30 Reviewed 9 December 2016 via mobile Wonderful Once Again! JUST PLAIN GOOD!! Great food, great service and cold beer! Simply love this place! The owners are involved in every step and don't plan on it being any other way. Date of visit: December 2016 Ask AFairAssessment about Happy's Bayou Bites Thank AFairAssessment This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Happy J, Owner at Happy's Bayou Bites, responded to this review Responded 12 December 2016 AFA, Thanks for the shout out once again and glad you get it! We enjoy cooking and making people happy, if not we'd have bought a MacDonalds. Report response as inappropriate Thank you. We appreciate your input. This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of Tripadvisor LLC happywinemaker Central NJ 78 63 Reviewed 7 December 2016 Stick with the gumbo avoid the shrimp & oyster poorboy Had lunch w wife on a weekday. You place your order at the counter & they bring your food to a picnic table right next to busy Main St aka 580. I had an oyster & shrimp combo poorboy-very small oysters & shrimp which were cooked well, but there just wasn't enough seafood on the roll for the $10.99 My wife had a Cajun grilled cheese- 4 half pieces which was good but a little greasy. The gumbo that came with her sandwich was delicious. We give it a 5 on the 1-10 scale Maybe other items on the menu are superior but will not try Happy's again to find out. They are only open 11am-4 or 6pm Wednesday to Saturday Date of visit: November 2016 Value Service Food Ask happywinemaker about Happy's Bayou Bites 1 Thank happywinemaker This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Happy J, Owner at Happy's Bayou Bites, responded to this review Responded 12 December 2016 HWM, Sorry to hear you had a bad experience. Wish you had expressed what was lacking because we would have fixed it immediately. Our goal is to have each customer leave happy. Report response as inappropriate Thank you. We appreciate your input. This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of Tripadvisor LLC DorothyJ958 Florida 52 19 Reviewed 29 November 2016 Don't By Pass This Place Here are found the best rice & beans dish ever, anywhere, in the world. The people are friendly, the customers are happy and satisfied. Order at the window; eat on picnic tables or take home, you will not be disappointed. Date of visit: October 2016 Value Service Food Ask DorothyJ958 about Happy's Bayou Bites Thank DorothyJ958 This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Happy J, Owner at Happy's Bayou Bites, responded to this review Responded 2 December 2016 Thanks Dorothy! Glad you had a good time and enjoyed the food. Come by this week for the Cajun Shrimp and Grits special. Good stuff! Report response as inappropriate Thank you. We appreciate your input. Tripadvisor 01/17/2025 Best oyster po boy and hush puppies outside of New Orleans.  Fun place to eat outside! A gem of Dunedin.  Reasonable prices Tripadvisor 05/28/2024 If you didn't look at the road behind you, you might think you were in the Louisiana Bayou or the Everglades. With a cool old school wooden facade and tables in the gravel under huge trees, it was a fun place for lunch. I liked my gator tail basket with... Tripadvisor 02/09/2024 Been going weekly for years, but these new owners donâ€™t cut it. Stood at the window like an idiot for 10mins being ignored, then waited another 20mins for my simple order of Jambalaya and Gumbo that was ALREADY MADE. All they needed to do was put it on... Tripadvisor 08/17/2023 Whenever I get a hankering for some good Cajun cooking, I head to Happy's place. Not only does he have great food but he is also a fellow veteran which is a win-win for me. Happy's Bayou Bites is Dunedin's 1st Veteran Owned & Friendly Business - Paradise News Magazine Skip to content Menu Current Issue Past Issues This Week This Weekâ€™s Email This Weekâ€™s Tidbits This Weekâ€™s Top 5 Subscribe to E-Newsletter Features Art News Arts & Leisure Listings Dining ECO Events Listings On Our Cover Features by Month August/September 2025 Features June/July 2025 Features May 2025 Features April 2025 Features March 2025 Features February 2025 Features January 2025 Features December 2024 Features November 2024 Features October 2024 Features Publishers Message Tidbits August/September 2025 Tidbits June/July 2025 Tidbits May 2025 Tidbits April 2025 Tidbits March 2025 Tidbits February 2025 Tidbits January 2025 Tidbits December 2024 Tidbits November 2024 Tidbits October 2024 Tidbits Lifestyle Artists Spotlight Condo Living Corey Avenue Market Downtown Concierge Fashion Gulfport Matters Hanging Around Local Businesses Home Improvement Local Focus Local History Advice Encouraging Words by Dr. Dennis Merritt Jones Health & Wellness Legal Corner Real Estate Events Top 5 Weekend Events Facebook Events Send us your event! Contact Send Paradise News A Letter to the Editors Distribution Locations Subscribe Happyâ€™s Bayou Bites is Dunedinâ€™s 1st Veteran Owned & Friendly Business November 10, 2018 by Paradise News Team The City of Dunedinâ€™s U.S. Military Veterans Advisory Committee is proud to recognize Happy Bayou Bites as their first business to be approved as a Veteran Owned & Veteran Friendly business. The Committee was established in January of 2018. One of their first initiatives was to create a program that recognizes businesses in Dunedin as Veteran Owned and/or Veteran Friendly. The Committee recently finalized the program requirements, application and approval process and set out to begin implementing the program and recognizing approved businesses. The first business to be approved and recognized by the Dunedin U.S. Military Advsiory Committee is Happyâ€™s Bayou Bites, a cajun and creole restaurant. The restaurant is 100% Veteran owned and offers $1 off meals to their Veteran customers. Owners, Mark and Happy Jordan opened Happyâ€™s Bayou Bites after Mark retired from the Army, both their kids had left the nest for their own Army adventures, and they were looking for something to do that included food, Dunedin, friends and serving their neighbors. Happyâ€™s Bayou Bites is located at 431 Skinner Blvd, Dunedin . Visit Happy Bayou Bites on Facebook to read about their story, hours, drink and mouth-watering menu items featuring cajun country cuisine. Show Off Your Military Support! Do you have a business that is Veteran Owned or Veteran Friendly? Requirements & Application. Once approved, you will receive a recognition decal to display at your business. The Veteran Owned/Veteran Friendly Business Recognition program is sponsored by the City of Dunedin U.S. Military Veterans Advisory Committee. For more information, contact Dunedin Parks & Recreation at (727) 812-4531.
